Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text:
Complete all of the following
Earn a minimum grade of C in each of the following: 
BSC2010C - Biology I (4)
BSC2011C - Biology II (4)
or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Fish biology and covers (in varying amounts of detail) the following topics: diversity, systematics, functional anatomy, physiology, ecology, evolution and conservation.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Department of Biology

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: A "C" (2.0) or better in both BSC 2010C and BSC 2011C, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The vertebrate animals, relationships of organs and systems, and their phylogenetic significance.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Department of Biology

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: BSC 2010C or equivalent.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Structure of the human body.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: College of Medicine Burnett School of Biomedical Sciences

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: BSC 2010C or equivalent and Consent of Honors.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Basic and functional anatomy in clinically oriented way to study systems within the human body. The lab component of this honors course provides enrichment and an opportunity to view cadaver specimens. With Honors Content.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: College of Medicine Burnett School of Biomedical Sciences

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: BSC 2010C, C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Gross anatomy for exercise physiology majors.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: College of Medicine Burnett School of Biomedical Sciences

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: BSC 2010C.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Biological principles governing the physiology of the nervous system including electrical properties, chemical signaling, cellular composition, development, injury and regeneration.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: College of Medicine Burnett School of Biomedical Sciences

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: BSC 2010C or BSC2010K, BHC student

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Comprehensive discussion of cellular composition of the nervous system and functions of each cell type, electrical and chemical communication; including neuroanatomy and neuropsychology of chemical, somatic and auditory system.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: College of Medicine Burnett School of Biomedical Sciences

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: PCB 3703C or ZOO 3733C or equivalent.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Basic principles of tissue staining, techniques, microscopy, cellular structure and other basic concepts. An introduction to the formation and structure of the four basic human tissues: Epithelium, Connective, Muscle & Nervous. Familiarizes students with normal cells, tissues structure and ultrastructure imaging.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: College of Medicine Burnett School of Biomedical Sciences

Prerequisites.text:
Complete all of the following
Earn a minimum grade of C in each of the following: 
BSC2010C - Biology I (4)
BSC2011C - Biology II (4)
PCB3044 - Principles of Ecology (3)
or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Comparative biology of invertebrates, emphasizing morphology, evolution, ecology and conservation biology.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Department of Biology

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text:
Complete all of the following
Earn a minimum grade of C in each of the following: 
BSC2011C - Biology II (4)
or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Comprehensive course in bird biology covering global diversity, evolution and systematics, anatomy, physiology, behavior, and ecology.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Department of Biology

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: A "C" (2.0) or better in all the following; BSC 2010C, BSC 2011C, PCB 3044, and PCB 3063, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Vertebrate evolution and ecology, based on the paleontological and ecological literature. The laboratory places heavy emphasis on classification/identification and field work.

Department.text: Department of Biology

ZOO4405C - Sea Turtle Ecology and Conser.name: ZOO4405C - Sea Turtle Ecology and Conservation Internship

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text:
Complete all of the following
Intern application, C.I.
Complete the following: 
ENC1101 - Composition I (3)

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Provide participants with hands-on field and research experience. Students will gain a foundation in the current state of sea turtle science and conservation.

Department.text: Department of Biology

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text:
Earn a minimum grade of C in each of the following: 
BSC2011C - Biology II (4)
PCB3044 - Principles of Ecology (3)

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Introduction to the biology of the amphibians and reptiles, their classification, evolution, and life histories.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Diversity and biology of mammals from an evolutionary perspective.

Department.text: Department of Biology

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: This lab will enhance topics covered in the lecture further exploring the anatomy and identification of mammals with hands-on experience.

Department.text: Department of Biology

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: A "C" (2.0) or better in PCB 3044.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Study of the current ideas in animal behavior, including the mechanism of behavior and evolutionary explanations.

Department.text: Department of Biology

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: A "C" (2.0) or better in both PCB 3063 and PCB 3023, or PCB 3522, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Concepts of developmental processes. Emphasis on mechanisms underlying vertebrate development.

ZOO4605 - Human Clinical Embryology and.name: ZOO4605 - Human Clinical Embryology and Congenital Malformation

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: ZOO 3733C.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Advanced functional human clinical embryology with focus on congenital abnormalities.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: College of Medicine Burnett School of Biomedical Sciences

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text:
Complete the following: 
ZOO3733C - Human Anatomy (4)

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Dissection techniques of the human body to teach students the skills required for the preparation of three dimensional materials(specimens). The primary student population should be junior/senior pre health professional applicants preparing for the basic medical sciences of professional schools.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: College of Medicine Burnett School of Biomedical Sciences

ZOO4735 - Anatomy of the Head and Neck.name: ZOO4735 - Anatomy of the Head and Neck

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: PR: BSC 2010C

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Structures of the facial skeleton, oral cavity, the teeth, the gums (gingiva , and the innervation of the head and neck specially the trigeminal nerve, as well as the blood supply, venous and lymphatic drainage of the head and neck including some selective pathological conditions.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: College of Medicine Burnett School of Biomedical Sciences

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Advanced topics in movement, vision, motivation, sex and brain, emotions, biological rhythms, sleep, language, attention, mental illness, development, learning, memory, degeneration, regeneration.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: College of Medicine Burnett School of Biomedical Sciences

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: ZOO 3733C with a B (3.0) or better.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Basic and applied neurosciences with attention to normal function and pathologic states of the nervous system relevant to practice of general medicine and/or neuroscience.

Department.text: College of Medicine Burnett School of Biomedical Sciences

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Basic and applied neurosciences with attention to normal function and pathologic states of the nervous system relevant to practice of general medicine and/or neuroscience.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Clinically oriented teachings in major neuroscience areas including selected topics in neuropathology, neurooncology, neuroimmunology, neuropharmacology, and neurodiagnostics.

Department.text: College of Medicine Burnett School of Biomedical Sciences

Prerequisites.text: ZOO 3744 or ZOO 4743C and BHC

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Clinically oriented teachings of neuroscience areas including selected topics in neuropathology, neuro-oncology, neuroimmunology, neuropharmacology and neurodiagnostics with Honors content.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text:
Complete the following: 
ZOO3733C - Human Anatomy (4)

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Vast intricacies of the four basic human tissues. Study the normal tissue structure/ultrastructure by observing and assessing microanatomy of certain mammalian organs, but mostly human tissues.

Prerequisites.text:
Earn a minimum grade of C in each of the following: 
ZOO3713C - Comparative Vertebrate Anatomy (5)

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: A comparison of vertebrate anatomy at the tissue level and its evolutionary and phylogenetic significance.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: A minimum grade of a "B" (3.0) in ZOO 4513.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: An advanced course where students will be observing, documenting, and analyzing animal behavior in a zoological setting.
